Goal: Earn the most victory points during the game, the points represent that the General is satisfied with a player. Points are given to those who control the resources, that construct buildings, that produce weapons and that use certain special buildings.

167312.name: Dungeons: The Eye of Draconus
167312.description:
Are you ready for a multiplayer, early 90's, arcade brawler experience? Then mount up, charge your abilities and ready yourself for a Golden Axe parody, with a serious pair of unicorn balls!

Dungeons the Eye of Draconus is a one to three player retro arcade style brawler, with both local and online multiplayer support, complete with mounts; multiple attacks, and varied gameplay, all reminiscent of Battle Toads and TMNT Arcade.

With a variety of enemies filling every stage, boredom is kept at bay as you and your friends battle through a bizzare fantasy world. A hilarious story, complete with cut scenes, dialogue sequences and professional voice acting.

Join Gleobryn the cleric, Rose the thief and Bolax the barbarian as they journey through ancient mountains, fight primitive Kobolds, raid an orkish fraternity and deal with all kinds of crazy characters in, "Dungeons the Eye of Draconus".

Source: The Developer Website.

167313.name: Speed Kills
167313.description:
Speed Kills is a traditional, isometric racing game, powered by Unreal Engine. Players compete in various championships, ranging from bootleg rallies on the outskirts of the galaxy to big-league circuits set against the goliath skylines of metropolis cityscapes. You can purchase offensive and defensive vehicle upgrades, buy new cars, collect power-ups and earn bonuses.

Features


Classic gameplay, influenced by the games like Rock n’ Roll Racing
Over 100 races
Over 50 unique tracks
5 planets/championships to compete
Diverse locations: from postnuclear wastelands to futuristic cityscapes
Upgradable vehicles, ranging from monster trucks to hi-tech hovercars


Source: The Developer Website.

167314.name: Magic Rainbow
167314.description:
Magic Rainbow is a game designed to help children learn colors and read color words. Players move along the magic rainbow track by drawing a card with either a color or the name of a color printed on it. They then move to the next space of that color on the track (similar to Candyland). First player to reach the top of the rainbow wins. There are also obstacles (such as black clouds with rainbow slides) that can set players back.

This game has an interesting game board. It is large (20"x26") and comes as four giant puzzle pieces to be assembled.

167315.name: Residue: Final Cut
167315.description:
A journey to an environmental disaster that holds many secrets

Residue is a story-driven 2D platform adventure in which you control three characters with different abilities, exploring an abandoned excavation site in the remains of the Aral Sea in present-day Uzbekistan. Once the fourth largest lake in the world, the Aral Sea is now an arid wasteland, a victim of decades of Soviet cotton irrigation. To some, it is the prime example for humanity to stay out of nature's business. To others, it's a world waiting to be saved.

After a year of additional polish, taking all of the feedback we've received on the original release into account and making tons of the changes we previously didn't have the means to, we're satisfied to call this the Final Cut.

Source: The Developer Website.

167316.name: Service
167316.description:
From the designer's website:

Service is a freeform live action role-playing scenario about United States citizens called up for military service during a brutal war.

Each player takes on the role of a citizen who has been torn out of their everyday life and brought to the Orientation Center for deployment to basic training. Everything they own has been removed from them as they are about to embark on the transformational experience of becoming a soldier.

This is game about saying goodbye to the life you’ve known, about patriotism versus the reality of war, and issues of personal versus societal responsibility.

167317.name: Esbirros Bizarros
167317.description:
Esbirros Bizarros (Bizarre Minions) is a party game for up to 25 players, which can be played everywhere with anoyone.

The game is played with only one deck of 25 cards, those are divided in "Power Morfys" green cards, "Skulls" grey cards, and special cards such as "Intergalacticos", "Chuchos Infernales", "The Croten One", "El Cornado" and "El Crack".

Each card will add or substract points and have an special action that the player must do. Some times this actions are imposible like "wash your brain in oil", but should do something to satisfy Goo Zman.

Each player takes 2 cards (or 1 if there are more that 13 players), this cards must not be shown to other players. Only the player that gets the card named Goo Zman, reveals it so all players can see it.
The goal of this player is to find as many Power Morfys can, and adquire the highest points posible, avoiding "Skulls" and negative cards. To do so, he must pick one player at a time to show one of his cards (the picked player choose one of his cards). Gooz Man will loose if he gets -25 points.

The players must decide if they want to help Goo Zman, or not. Since
they can persuade him to being pick with lies or helping him giving clues to who he should pick, but never reveal their cards until they are picked by Goo Zman. If the player choose to show a negative card, this player will win if Gooz Man loose. If the player choose a positive card, the player will win if Goo Zman wins. When a player already had a picked card and must show his other card, the new card will be his win chance.

There is also an special card named "Diabolo", this player will only win if he is not picked.

It's a very fun and crazy game that can last from 1 minute to 20 minutes.

167318.name: Radical Heroes: Crimson City Crisis
167318.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




User Summary

Radical Heroes: Crimson City Crisis is an arcade beat’em up where you play a radical hero. You will be fighting to free your city from Eyeclopse, an ancient inter-dimensional threat that aims to rule the whole universe. Which makes Crimson City no longer safe! Do you have what it takes to save Crimson City from the evil Eyeclopse?

167319.name: Tiamat X
167319.description:
The evil Choazid Empire has launched a surprise attack on your homeworld, establishing a heavily fortified base from where their forward assault group burrows deep underground, capturing subterranean lifeforms and transforming them into vicious biomechs.

With it being only a matter of time before the Choazids start converting your people, it’s up to you to take the controls of one of the few remaining Tiamat dragonship prototypes: the X class fighter, a craft capable of immense firepower – provided you pick up enough upgrade caches during a mission where you must dodge and blast like there’s no tomorrow.

Featuring six levels of intense shooting action, Tiamat X is a rip-snortin tribute to the side-scrolling shooters of yesteryear, and would be right at home blazing away on the screen of a booming, beer-stained arcade cabinet. As such, your PC, phone or tablet will have to do, and it is much to the designer’s regret that he can’t plumb a coin-slot into his rig for that truly authentic seaside amusement-park experience.

Get some big speakers, though. Really, we do recommend them for this game.

Features


Auto fire – this is primarily intended as an accessibility option and allows the player to not have to worry about using a fire button.
Quick fire – don’t like mashing buttons/keys, then this is for you. Press and hold to fire.
Colour blind filter – this filter adjusts the game thereby making it more colour blind friendly. We just hope we have got it right!
Six levels of intense shooting action
Original music score


Source: The Developer Website.

167320.name: SickBrick
167320.description:
User Summary

Sick Brick is a FPS with modern graphics and old-school gameplay inspired by Portal and Serious Sam.

There are 15 levels in the game, mixing indoor and outdoor areas. You're forced to do tests for an unknown robotic mastermind. While going through the tests, you will slowly unravel the story through log files the previous test subjects have left behind.

167321.name: Skylancer: Battle for Horizon
167321.description:
User Summary

Skylancers: Battle for Horizon was a free-to-play MMORTS available from alaplaya.net. When starting the game, a player must join one of three factions: the Empire, Alliance or Renegades - all conveniently color coded, red for Empire, blue for Alliance, and green for the Renegades. The player could never change factions, and would stay with that faction throughout the entire game. Each faction had access to different tactics and abilities when in battle.

The game focused around building up the player's personal floating island. When the player built specific places on the island, the player could unlock more resources which could be used to build a navy. This navy would be used to raid locations around the world when on quests. The player had the option of fighting AI creatures, or you could battle other players directly.

There were quests that players could complete scattered around the world. Some were quests where the player had to kill a certain number of sky pirates, others were quests to control certain islands in the vast seas of Horizon. There were new quests added at different times throughout the year too.

A unique point of the game was that each faction was competing to control the moon. The moon would travel around the planet of Horizon, and once a month would be tethered to an island in the ocean. Whatever faction controlled that island, everyone of that faction could complete the quests on the moon - and no one else could. This meant entire factions would do focused strikes against specific islands during the month, leading to some very cut-throat battles.

While the game was a browser game, it did require Microsoft Silverlight to run. It also followed a pay-to-win model, where the more money a player put into the game, the better ships, cards, and equipment that player would receive. While someone could play the game without buying such things, but it would take much longer to achieve the more advanced levels than if that player had spent money.

Unfortunately, in May 2013, alaplaya stopped hosting Skylancer. There is currently no way for anyone to play or access this game. The game is now owned by GamesInFlames, but there has been no recent news on what is going to happen to it.

167322.description:
In Mushrooms, players take turns collecting mushrooms on the forest by moving a shared basket. The mushrooms can be good or bad, and thus score positive or negative points. The basket is moved according to some simple rules:

You cannot move in the direction of the previous move
You must move in a straight line
You must land on a space occupied by a mushroom




The player with more points when no more moves are possible wins the game.
167322.name: Mushrooms

167323.name: Playground Magazine (Issue 5 – 2012)
167323.description:
From Editor's Introduction:

Issue #5 of Playground magazine explores what happens when we mix story and game. We are not interested in discussing whether roleplaying events can be stories or can be games. Most of they time they are a bit of both, and none of the above, which is what makes them so cool.

Highlights
Guide to stories & games: What's the story and what's the game?
A peek into the box: Pictorial from Blackbox CPH
On alibi and ecstasy: A tool to creating better LARPs
The perfect alibi: Why LARPers shouldn't date
Lance Weiler and new media: Look into cutting-edge games
Jim Babb: Stuff happens
Why not reruns? - A happy little family game.
10 Ways to manipulate your players
8 Ways to hack the larp
Review: Leaving Mundania: Journalist investigates American LARPers
LARPing in Russia

167324.name: Playground Magazine (Issue 6 – 2012)
rpgissuearticle: 5 things we lie about in larp
167324.description:
"From the introduction:'

In case you were wondering whether or not we are artists, stop wondering. We are. Artists are also the worst breed of people at talking trash about fantastic projects... It doesn't have the same impact the second time you see a urinal in an art gallery, but let us give a bit of elbow room to theose who have not seen the urinal there before.

Highlights
Fastival of Change:
We're laughing at YOU!
States of Stasis: review - Solmukohta 2012
Krigslive - a changing LARP: They fight, and fight, and fight and fight.
24-hour LARP design: Aaron Vanek on fast design
5 things we lie about in LARP
The Nordic Invasion: What Nordic & American LARPers can learn from each other
A strange journey into Solmukohta: What is it and what isn't it?
How bleed is ruining LARP: personal uproar from Rasmus Høgdall

167325.name: Playground Magazine (Issue 7 – 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Parlor games that will fuck you up!
The big test of simulated sex
167325.description:
From the introduction:

Highlights
Charlie and the improv factory: What is the fuzz about improv?
Why rerun Just a little lovin' ?: What can we learn from reruns?
Learning in Lithuania
The big test of simulated sex
Guide to US conventions: 35 - 46,000 participants.
Larping with strangers at Roskilde 2012
The 41 Year Old Virgin: LARPing for the first time
Parlor games that will fuck you up!
What about safety? Another uproar from Rasmus.
Structured freeform defined: Let's agree to what we're talking about!

167326.name: Traumwind (Issue 6 - 1989)
rpgissuearticle: Wie Gwidon den Drachen am Schwanz zog oder Die Rache des Spielleiters
167326.description: This issue, published after a two-year break due to military service of the editor(s?), contains several short stories and two comics, but no scenario, as the editorial concedes.

167327.name: Florensia
167327.description:
"Florensia is a free-to-play role playing game and a fantasy game with islands and the vast ocean.
In this free-to-play MMORPG fantasy game, you can choose between 12 character classes and build your own ship by selecting from five different ship types.

In the online role playing game Florensia, you can discover the various islands while increasing your land and sea level.
Meet the international community in Florensia, post in the forum and be friends with players from the entire Western Global world in Florensia’s anime fantasy game forum with fun and great discussions about the game."

Source: The Publisher Website.

167328.name: Sorceress Bloody Sorceress
167328.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Once received, the invitation—delivered through the song of a magpie—cannot be ignored. And so, with trepidation and outright dread, the guests gather to the table of the sorceress, high upon her drafty tower.

Sorceress Bloody Sorceress is a game of intrigue, murder, and dinner parties with unwanted guests.

Originally published in Worlds Without Master (Volume 1, Issue 5 - Aug 2014), the game is also available as a standalone PDF from the publisher's site.

167329.name: 101 Swamp Spells
167329.description:
From publisher blurb:

Don’t Explore Swamps Unprepared!

101 Swamp Spells enhances the range of spellcasting options for players and gives GMs exciting new ways to challenge the marsh-exploring adventurers in their campaigns.

Want to really take advantage of those slow-rolling banks of fog on the edges of the swamp? Any interest in changing what natural toxins do? Want more ways to enjoy creatures from will-o-wisps and stirges to oozes and jellies?

167330.name: The Thing from the Future
167330.description:
From the publisher's game overview:

The object of the game is to come up with the most entertaining and thought-provoking descriptions of hypothetical objects from different near-, medium-, and long-term futures. Each round, players collectively generate a creative prompt by playing a card game. This prompt outlines the kind of future that the thing-to-be-imagined comes from, specifies what part of society or culture it belongs to, describes the type of object that it is, and suggests an emotional reaction that it might spark in an observer from the present. Players must then each write a short description of an object that fits the constraints of the prompt. These descriptions are then read aloud (without attribution), and players vote on which description they find the most interesting, provocative, or funny. The winner of each round keeps the cards put into play for that round, and whoever has the most cards when the game ends is declared the overall winner.

167331.name: Pathways (Issue 43 - Oct 2014)
rpgissuearticle: 101 Not So Random Encounters: Forest Kingdom
The Edgewalker: Wielder of Light and Darkness
Veranthea Codex: Braxthar Grimdrahk, Scientific Innovator (Alchemist Archetype)

167332.description:
Loot & Recruit is a deck building game that brings a twist to the genre through it's stacking mechanic, dual currency system, and PvP elements. Become a contestant in a crazy Goblin festival as you compete for the title of Goblin King. During the festival, you will add new cards to your deck, recruit Goblins for victory points, attack other players, and hire minions to perform special actions. Do you have what it takes to loot and recruit well enough to claim the throne for yourself?

Features:

Deck building mechanic allows you to create your own strategy as you choose and accumulate more cards for your deck.
Stacking mechanic leaves your Goblins vulnerable at all times, so stack carefully to ensure their protection.
Play dirty, attack your opponent's Goblins and send them crumbling to the ground.
Hire minions to perform powerful actions for you.
Every round a new Event Card changes up the landscape of the game.
167332.name: Loot & Recruit

167333.description:
With the tile pack you can expand your battles with a larger play area.

Contents:
- Nine 2-sided tiles (matching the core set)
167333.name: Rivet Wars: Tile Set

167334.name: Generations
167334.description:
Generations is a collection of three games, also referred to as three "generations" (Discovery, Conquest and War). There are rules to play each game individually, but the set can be played in sequence as one long game, taking the players from the discovery of a new land, through colonization and industrialization, and finally to a bitter war for complete control of the land.

The first generation, Discovery takes about 45-60 minutes to play. You compete to grow your population while creating a unique map on which the other games will be played. Pieces are drawn at random, and different types of placements result in different "scores". It is a relatively simple game of geometric strategy, along the lines of "Dominoes," "Carcassonne" or "Blokus". Your final score is based on how effectively and efficiently you "discovered" the land.

The second generation, Conquest takes about 60-90 minutes to play and is played on top of the map created by Generation One. This game is a race to colonize the map and build industries. You roll dice to determine where you can place your people on the board, or how you can impede your opponents. You trade in people from different land types to build industries. You can also build trade routes (allowing you to move people around) and fortifications (to protect industries). You have to manage your assets wisely to win, but timing and luck play a role as well. The first player to achieve a "stable society" with four industries wins.

The third generation, War, also takes 60-90 minutes to play and is played from the end state of Generation Two. Your people have all become soldiers, trade routes are now blockades, and your industries are repurposed for the war effort. The basic mechanic for battle is similar to other world conquering games (like "Risk") but your industries and blockades all have unique affects on the battlefield. Your armies can move and span across territories, resulting in a war that can ebb and flow to the very end. The last remaining player is the winner.

The three games/generations are balanced in such a way to make it unlikely for a single player to win all three. And each generation uses different mechanics and different skills, allowing players of different types to engage with it.

167335.name: Things Don't Go Smooth
167335.description:
From the back cover:

CREWS SHOULD KNOW THINGS DON'T GO SMOOTH

Need help gettin' your Crew into heaps of trouble? THINGS DON'T GO SMOOTH expands the 'Verse with a passel of characters and shiny new rules like scene and location triggers. Perfect for an upstanding GM like yourself! To use what you find in THINGS DON'T GO SMOOTH, you'll need a copy of the FIREFLY ROLE-PLAYING GAME. Dong ma?

WHAT YOU GET IN THIS HERE BOOK

NEW VILLAINS AND VARMINTS
Meet spies & crime bosses, rival crews, the unexplained, and more!

PACKED WITH GM ADVICE AND RULES
Find advice on Reavers and an Episode generator! Filled with new Distinctions, triggers, and more.

TWO NEW FULL-LENGTH ADVENTURES
Introduce your new Antagonists and rules with "Merciless" and "Thieves in Heaven"!

From publisher blurb:

Life's not easy. Don't matter whether you're flying a leaky boat along the Rim or dodging Alliance cruisers in the Core, there's always something or somebody getting in the way of a Crew's honest day's work.

THINGS DON'T GO SMOOTH presents a baker's dozen of shady crews, crime bosses, megalomaniacs, and unexplainable phenomena designed to get in the way of your Crew. Each includes a wealth of story hooks, supporting characters, locations, ships, and background material to help you bring the 'Verse to your table.

GMs will also find over 50 new Distinctions and Signature Assets, new enemy boats, rules for scene Traits and triggers, plus the Episodes "Merciless" and "Thieves in Heaven" to bring these characters to life! The FIREFLY RPG is required to use this supplement.

We think you'll appreciate the following:

Find 4 types of Antagonists ranging from crime bosses to the unexplained.
Offers advice on how to handle Reavers using Cortex Plus.
New rules introduce scene Triggers — giving GMs more dice to roll!
Use our fancy Episode Generator. Never get stuck for ideas again!

167336.name: Threshold (Issue 5 - Oct 2014) Exploring Davania
rpgissuearticle: History and Origins of the Rakasta
Ranesh, a City of Four People
The History of Ierendi and Minrothad, Part 3
Y’hog – The Blackest Port in the West
167336.description:
From the back cover:

Exploring Davania

It's a wonderful continent, but could be unforgiving, if you're lost in a remote land and you know nothing of its people and its creatures.

In this issue of Threshold Magazine you'll get to know the dangers and the opportunities of Davania much better, from lush landscapes to forgotten ruins, from civilized nations to untamed wilderness. Either could be certain death or neverending glory for the brave explorers willing to face the unknown.

Join the exploration of Mystara's great southern continent! Here you will find at least some directions. Will you ever be able to return home or will you stay in Davania to live or die?

167337.name: Bingo Bandit
167337.description:
From the box:
Bingo Bandit is a bingo game that "combines the luck of a one-armed bandit and bingo with clever strategy!"

User description:
The game features a large plastic bingo machine with a slot in the top for tokens which fall out through chutes at the bottom when the arm of the slot machine is pulled.

The object of the game is to make complete rows on your game card or complete rows on other players' cards in order to collect points. The player with the most points wins the game.

167338.description:
This promo card is given as a reward for participating on Organized play. This is part of the Allegiance in Blood story arc.

Dispel

Incantation, Metamagic
Cost X Mana

Destroy ther target. X = total mana cost of target enchantment (casting plus reveal cost)
167338.name: Mage Wars: Dispel Promo Card

167339.description:
This promo card is given as a reward for participating on Organized play. This is part of the Allegiance in Blood story arc.

Minor Heal

Incantation, Healing
Cost 5 Mana

Heal target creature the amount rolled on 5 attack dice.
167339.name: Mage Wars: Minor Heal Promo Card

167340.name: NBA 2K15
videogameversion: North America Xbox One physical edition
videogamehonor: 2014 Global Game Awards Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
2014 The Game Awards Best Sports/Racing Game of the Year Nominee
2015 D.I.C.E. Sports Game of the Year Nominee
167340.description:
NBA 2K15 is a basketball simulation video game developed by Visual Concepts and published by 2K Sports. It is the sixteenth installment of the NBA 2K franchise. It was released on October 7, 2014 in North America for Microsoft Windows, Xbox One, Xbox 360, PS3 and PS4. It will be released on October 9, 2014 in Australia and October 10, 2014 in the rest of the world. Kevin Durant of the Oklahoma City Thunder, one of the three cover athletes of NBA 2K13, is the solo cover athlete of NBA 2K15. NBA 2K15 is the successor to NBA 2K14 in the NBA 2K series and also the 15th installment.

The game will have a pre-order bonus pack which includes 5,000 Virtual Currency (VC), 2 MyTEAM card packs, your choice of an International MyTEAM card or rookie Kevin Durant , and MyPLAYER leg sleeves inspired by Durant. On August 6, 2014 it was announced that Crew mode will be back in the game, then on August 7, 2014 it was announced that the game will have a new mode called MyLEAGUE, which is similar to NBA 2K14's MyGM mode but with added customization and improvements. MyLEAGUE also has no RPG elements, such as the conversation system and press conferences. On September 17, 2014 it was announced a face scan will be introduced into the game. It takes 30 seconds. It doesn't capture an image but maps a 3d model of your face instantly adding your face into the game. There will be a MyNBA2K15 app that will come out along with the game, just like NBA 2K14 came out with MyNBA2K14. The app releases on the day of the game release.

On August 13, 2014 it was announced that the PC version will have all the same features and graphics capacity as the Xbox One and PS4 versions.

Source: Wikipedia, "NBA 2K15", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167341.name: Project Spark
videogamehonor: 2013 Game Critics Best Social/Casual/Puzzle Game of the Year Nominee
2015 D.I.C.E. Best Innovation of the Year Nominee
2015 D.I.C.E. Family Game of the Year Nominee
167341.description:
Project Spark is a "game maker" video game for Microsoft Windows 8.1 and Xbox One. The game was announced during Microsoft's E3 2013 press event, and was launched as a Windows open beta in December 2013, and an Xbox One beta in March 2014. It is based on Kodu Game Lab and is planned to be released in October 7, 2014.

Gameplay

Project Spark Is a digital canvas which can be used to make games, movies and other experiences. A player can download other user-generated content, remix that content or create content of their own. A player can use the Xbox controller, keyboard and mouse, touch-devices, Kinect and SmartGlass to build experiences. Kinect can be used to animate models and record audio. The created environments can contain mountains, rivers, and towns. The player can also create events, like inter-character battles. Created items and objects are able to be shared with other players.

Players choose whether to start from a blank map or a pre-designed level, but always have the tools to customize the topography, add plant and animal life, and program behaviors for specific objects, such as a rock that bounces when a player is nearby. The topography is modified by pushing and pulling the earth, digging through surfaces after changing the view to adjust a wall or create holes in it. Anything added to the terrain reacts to the circumstance, such as grass covering the floor and the vertical surfaces becoming rocks.

Game designer Claude Jerome has said that "the game is all about giving players options", like the ability to add a single flower versus a field of flowers just by resizing the flower paintbrush's size. He added that the game is also about "sharing and playing with the community", and that the difference between Spark and LittleBigPlanet or Minecraft is the core ability to customize the game down to the minutiae of the in-game object actions, which lets the players tell more individual stories. Players can control the game with the Xbox controller, SmartGlass, or a keyboard/mouse combination. The SmartGlass interface mirrors the Xbox One display, but adapts for touch controls when in editor mode.

Worlds created in the game are shareable. Other players who enter can use the world as created, and a duplicate world is created if they would like to make changes.

According to a post from Mike Lescault on the social media website reddit, Project Spark will not require an Xbox Live Gold Membership to be played.

The game will also feature the character Conker the Squirrel.

Source: Wikipedia, "Project Spark", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167342.name: Tenkai Knights: Brave Battle
167342.description:
Tenkai Knights: Brave Battle (テンカイナイト ブレイブバトル Tenkai Naito Bureibu Batoru) is a Fighting video game developed and published by Bandai Namco Games, based on the anime series Tenkai Knights. It is released for the Nintendo 3DS on September 25, 2014 in Japan and on October 7, 2014 in North America.

Development

The game is being developed by Bandai Namco Games and was first announced in January 2014. In the game Guren, Ceylan, Toxsa and Chooki accidentally fell through an inter-dimensional portal. When they find themselves on the other side, the group are on another world and have assumed the mantles of Bravenwolf, Tributon, Valorn and Lydendor — otherwise known as the legendary Tenkai Knights.

Gameplay

In Tenkai Knights: Brave Battles, the player builds and customizes robots and then engages in combat with other robots. The game draws inspiration from the Tenkai Knights animated series.

Source: Wikipedia, "Tenkai Knights: Brave Battle", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167343.name: Chronicle of Sorcery
167343.description:
From the publisher's website:

When darkest sorcery and the mysteries of magic are laid bare, such power will shake the lands themselves. Chronicle of Sorcery is a supplement that details the core mechanics for magical power into any game powered by the Chronicle System, providing the foundation for entire systems of sorcerous might. Includes the basic Sorcery mechanics, new Benefits and Drawbacks, Common Sorceries, and new Holdings for the Houses with magic at their disposal.

Chronicle of Sorcery is the third of our Chronicle System series of PDFs, for use with the Chronicle System engine that powers our popular A Song of Ice & Fire Roleplaying system!

boardgamehonor: 2015 Origins Awards Best Miniature Figure Rules Nominee
167344.description: The Alpha Strike Companion adds new rules and expanded options for BattleTech: Alpha Strike, the miniatures war game. This expansion adds new tactical abilities, special warrior options, design quirks, and unit types. It includes an expanded abstract aerospace system that will enable simulation of conflicts from planet to jump point. The book also incorporates a handy conversion system that allows for translating the stats for any BattleTech unit to its fast-playing Alpha Strike equivalent.
167344.name: BattleTech: Alpha Strike Companion

167345.name: Veggie Sales
167345.description:
Welcome to the Veggie Mall! Hold your shopping lists tight, Keep your eyes wide opened, get ready for the crazy daily sales and the veggie high! Veggie Sales is a simultaneous action game where players try to fulfill, as quickly as possible, their shopping cards with a variety of vegetables. The player, who collects the most vegetables in order to fulfill their shopping cards, becomes the happiest veggie shopper and wins the game!

How to play:
Players start the game with a certain number of Shopping Cards in hands and share a basket of random Vegetable Tokens in the center of the table. The youngest player shouts out “Veggie Sales!” and everyone tries to manipulate the Vegetable Tokens in the Shopping Basket so as to match the compositions on their Shopping Cards. There are three things players can do:
(1) put ONE Vegetable Token into the basket,
(2) remove ONE Vegetable Token from the basket, or
(3) swap exactly TWO Vegetable Tokens in and out of the basket.
If a player thinks that they can fulfill one of their Shopping Cards in hand, they immediately play the card in front of them, grab the Shopping Basket, and perform exactly one of the three possible actions to fulfill the card they have just played. If it successfully matches the card, they place the Shopping Card, face-up, beside them as their scores, and return the basket to the center of the table. After that they give exactly one Shopping Card in hand to any one player next to them. However, if they fail to match the card, they must turn over one of their scored card (if any), face-down, and return the basket to the center of the table, and other players may try to play cards and grab the basket for themselves.
The game ends immediately when one player has got rid of all their cards in hand. All players count the total vegetable icons shown on their scored Shopping Cards. Whoever collects the most vegetable icons wins.

167346.name: The Emperor of Darkness
167346.description:
There are 3 color streets,
6 mafia families.
And just one 'Emperor of darkness'...

Can you stand alone on the Throne of Dark Street?
Can you build the greatest family?
Can you make the offer that can't refuse?

Be aware! 'Undercover cop' is watching you...

1. This is an auction game based on mafia ranks.
2. Players must consider which card to take by strategically placing his card.
3. Form a strategy that works best for your hand.
4. Players must work to raise his(her) Group to a higher level by recruiting big bosses.
5. Players must be diligent to not let an undercover cop infiltrate his group.
6. Players must strategize so that 2 factions of the same background do not grow together.

Gameplay is dynamic and intense. and Every game is different!

167347.name: Lockdown
167347.description:
From the publishers webpage

Voices of Disaster
The voices are getting louder. Strange voices, dissonant voices, sometimes babbling nonsense, sometimes telling stories too unbelievable to be true. People are falling prey to the voices, losing their identities as someone or something else slips into their skin. It’s affecting people at all levels of society, from squatters in burned-out warehouses to corporate CEOs. It’s spreading, and no one can figure out how to stop it. Boston-based NeoNET is at the center of this storm, and panic is spreading through the streets of the northeastern sprawl. People are scared and people are dying, which means that there are large sums of money to be made by any shadowrunner willing to brave those chaotic streets. Finding work won’t be the problem. Getting out of the sprawl, however, will be.

Lockdown is a plot sourcebook for Shadowrun, Fifth Edition with plot hooks, setting details of Boston, character details, and surprising reveals that will keep characters on their toes and running for their lives. With rich plot information and game mechanics for a new breed of cognitive fragmentation disorder sufferers, Lockdown can play a vital role in enthralling Shadowrun campaigns while continuing the unfolding story of the Sixth World.

167348.name: TetMithra
167348.description:
"Mitra" is a symbol of light and truth in aryan myth, and "Mithra" is a angel divinity in Zoroastrianism. These beings come into conflict in TetMithra, a game in which you score by placing blocks on your own game board or cut down your opponent's score by placing blocks on his.

To set up the game, each player creates a grid of number tiles by drawing the tiles from a bag and placing them on his game board; these tiles contain four squares in a row, with the squares being red, green, yellow and blue and containing the numbers 3-6 in some order. On the first turn, the starting player draws three block tiles, which show the shape of the blocks available for this turn; the blocks are Tetris-style quadrominoes that have squares in four colors. The player chooses one of these pieces and places it on his board within one minute, scoring points for the like-colored squares touching this block. Thus, if a red 5 on his grid is adjacent to a red square on the block he just placed, he scores five points.

The next player then reveals a new block tile, reveals the new block, then places one of the three blocks in his grid. From a player's third turn on, he can choose to place a block in an opponent's grid, costing him points.

The game ends when either only two blocks remain unplaced, no blocks can be placed in either grid, or one player has more than 180 points or less than -50 points. At this time, the player with the most points wins.

boardgameintegration: Guerra de Mitos VI: Portals activated
Myths at War (Nordic, Egyptian and Japanese)
Guerra de Mitos VI: Portals activated
Myths at War (Nordic, Egyptian and Japanese)
167349.description:
Guerra de Mitos V (The Celtic Pact) is a card game set in a fantastic world where different mythologies coexist. It is a different, dynamic game designed to be able to build different decks with very distinct and varied strategies, and each expansion increases both the number of available mythologies and the game possibilities.

All expansions can be played on its own.

The game contains 150 cards between Celtics and reinforcements for other GDM packs. Celtic Pact includes 6 pantheons (cards that define your game strategy) + 33 cards for the gods deck (which includes characters, events and resources) + 40 cards for the designs deck (actions, equipment and summonings) and reinforcements to 150 new cards for GDM.

Each player needs to build his own deck of at least 51 cards (1 pantheon / 20 gods / 30 designs) of his choice, and each installment increases the diversity of characters, actions and strategies you can use in order to achieve victory.

Each player has to bring into play the cards his oracles offer him and play actions from the designs deck both in the influence phase (where the gods plan from their pantheon) and in the confrontation phase (where the characters who decide to go to battle fight to decrease the opponent’s power) to obtain supremacy or consign the opponent to oblivion.

Integrates with:

Myths at War (Nordic, Egyptian and Japanese)
167349.name: Guerra De Mitos V

167350.name: The Abandoned Room
167350.description:
From publisher blurb:

One Page Number Twenty-One: The Abandoned Room contains descriptions of twenty rooms and/or their contents: strange to intriguing to creepy.

The One Page series gives the GM instant access to random tables full of woodland landmarks, strange objects, minor treasures, clever traps, and more! Each One Page product contains twenty unique, system-neutral entries in ready-to-roll format. Each entry can be easily adapted to any fantasy role-playing game.

167351.name: Chimera
167351.description:
From publisher blurb:

An alternative way to enjoy The Lazy GM. Maybe you need a monster for a campaign but don't want to buy a large collection. The Lazy GM Single Shots take a single monster and give variant Hit Dice, templates, builds and class levels for both Pathfinder and traditional 3.5 OGL, for a bargain price.

Chimeras features material previously found in The Lazy GM: Dungeon Beasts, but adds some new material including the multi-classed chimera marauder, the nightmare and half-fiend chimeras and notes on using chimeras in your game.

A fully clickable index cross-referenced by CR and templates, plus bookmarks, means you can easily find just what you need.

167352.name: Harridan
167352.description:
From publisher blurb:

HARRIDAN!!

A powerful sorceress with malicious intent, Harridan's ready to give your heroes a run for their money! Formerly a member of the Pentacle of Shadows, she's now raised her own army of evil creatures and is targeting your campaign city! Running won't help you escape her grasp!

167353.name: Launch Bay
167353.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a full-color, 48 inch by 20 inch, floor plan of a Launch Bay, with Hex, Square and No overlay.

The PDF includes includes the VTT (Virtual Table Top Images for online play).

“Emergency! Explosion on the flight deck! Enemy boarding party! Space marines to the flight deck!”

DramaScape launches into space again with our latest map!

Launch Bay is an interior map of a futuristic hangar with a control room for coordination of take-off and landing of fighters. This is suitable for use as the landing bay of a space carrier, air carrier (can’t operate in space, only in a planetary atmosphere), or a terrestrial airbase on a planet.

Launch Bay is intended for use in near or far-future science fiction games.

Adventure hook for use with this map:

Space Carrier War: Two space carriers face off, launching small fighters from their launch bays to destroy the enemy space carrier’s fleet with a second wave of small bombers with fighter escorts to finish off the enemy carrier. An enemy landing party crashes into the landing bay and then slides on top of the lift to prevent more fighters and bombers from being deployed. From the wreckage, robots use welding lasers to get out of the wrecked ship, wielding them to kill anyone in the way of their target, the command and control of the landing bay. Once they get to the doors of command and control, they use the welding lasers to breach the doors and get inside, attempting to kill the officers inside.

The Player Characters are space marines that rush to the landing bay to defeat the robots and defend the officers and the engineers who need to clear the deck of the wreck with construction mech suits to get to the lift and repair it. The space battle raging outside the ship becomes desperate for the player’s side as the expected reinforcements are not forthcoming while the lift is down.

Once the space marines restore the lift, they take the next bomber (and possibly fighters) in a mission of vengeance against the enemy space carrier. Perhaps even using a boarding ship to transport themselves into the enemy landing bay and return the favor by fragging the enemy’s commanders.

167354.name: The Dark Spiral
167354.description:
From the back of the book:

Spiral dust is a transcendent, wonderful, and orgasmic high. That's what users claim, eyes wide to reveal blue fractals instead of irises. Spiral dust addiction is on the rise. But why? Who is the Dustman who deals this strange substance from the shadows? And why do heavy spiral dust users tend to disappear without a trace?

In The Dark Spiral, the player characters are operatives of the Estate, a secretive organization pledged to protected the Earth. A mission to shut down a local dealer of spiral dust takes them farther than they expected when the trail leads to alternate, limited worlds called recursions where the rules of reality are different.

Game masters can intermix secondary Estate missions (in any order) with the main story arc of the adventure to create a mini-campaign. The Dark Spiral introduces players to the wonders of translating between alternate worlds of The Strange and showcases the narrative structure of the game.

In addition to introducing new locations new covered in The Strange corebook, The Dark Spiral offers new creatures, characters and items to add to any campaign.

167355.name: Nemesis
167355.description:
Nemesis is a 1-5 player survival sci-fi game where players are woken up from hibernation as a crew of a space ship. The emergency procedure states that there is a critical system failure and the space ship can't continue its cruise. The goal of the crew is to find what is causing this failure and fix the situation to safely return back to Earth. The main problem is that one crew member is dead. Somebody crashed his hibernation chamber and pulled his body out. In addition, if you listen closely, some additional noises and sounds can be heard. New ones, strange ones, ones that were never heard before…

Nemesis is a cooperation game combined with bluffing, backstabbing, and other elements of a science-fiction survival horror adventure.

167356.name: The Terramartian War Part 02: New Orders
167356.description:
From Introduction:

The Red Hawk of Mars knows he is fighting a battle of ideology against the Technocrats of Earth, and that the revolution must rally others to its cause.

The upper echelons of the Technocrats are loathe to publicly acknowledge that the fie of revolution is rapidly spreading, they know they must silence the whispers of revolution quickly.

Both sides understand that words are weapons, and those who control the flow of information, controls the masses.

The enemy is in control of a major communications array, and is utilizing it to broadcast the message of their propaganda to the impressionable masses. This problem must be corrected immediately.

Your orders are to destroy the Communications Array at any cost.

167357.name: Project Night
167357.description:
User Summary

Project Night has been designed in the vein of the survival horror genre in 90's. You explore your surroundings starting from a crashed car at night, avoiding or killing zombies in hopes of meeting up with the rest of humanity.

167358.name: Devils in Petticoats
167358.description:
From publisher blurb:

"FASCINATING AND DEADLY AS A COBRA..."

While researching comics to republish as part of NUELOW Games' ongoing RPG/Comics hybrid project, we came across two "true crime" stories focused on femme fatales, from two different Golden Age publishers, printed roughly a year apart, and with amost identicial titles and opening paragrams. So, Devils in Petticoats was born.

Devils in Petticoats presents two Golden Age crime comics stories and d20 OGL Modern rules (feats, four new starting professions, and a new talent tree) that will let your femme fatale characters vamp it up with the best (and worst!) of them.

167359.name: Princess Pantha: The Hunt for M'Gana
167359.description:
From publisher blurb:

"MISS ANIMAL TAMER -- YOU'RE IN QUITE A SPOT."

In 1946, the famous circus performer and animal trainer Princess Pantha vanished while on safari in Africa. This is the story of what happened next!

Princess Pantha: The Hunt for M'Gana collects the earliest adventures a character that debuted in the pages of Exciting Comics during the waning years of the Golden Age of Comics, but at the height of the popularity of jungle adventures in comics and movie theaters. Pantha was one of a trio of "jungle girl" series that Nedor published to capitalize not only on the popularity of the jungle adventure genre, but also on the success that rival publisher Fiction House had enjoyed with Sheena, Queen of the Jungle.

In addition to the classic comics by Art Saaf and Ralph Mayo (the main talents behind Nedor and NUELOW's other jungle girl, Judy), this book features feats and talent trees geared toward making characters with exceptional skills in dealing with animals, like Princess Pantha.

167360.name: Chopper Mike
167360.description:
Chopper Mike is a challenging, fast-paced, arcade helicopter time trial game featuring super smooth graphics and amazing controls.

Fly through 3 difficulty modes and 48 levels, picking up gems, avoiding collisions, and landing as quickly as you can! Skillful play will be rewarded with mysterious bonus aircraft!

Complete the levels, beat the target times, then replay to beat your best times!

Source: The Developer Website.

rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
167361.name: Angela & Miss Espionage
167361.description:
From publisher blurb:

ODDBALL GOLDEN AGE GIRL POWER!

Complete Golden Age Oddballs spotlights obscure characters from the Golden Age of comic books, in many cases collecting the stories in one place for the first time ever. Each issue in the series contain every single appearance of one or more quirky heroes from the founding years of the comic book genre, along with all-new roleplaying game content and an occassional bit of fiction.

In this volume, we spotlight the teen hellraiser Angela, and the international woman of mystery Miss Espionage. In addition to every single Golden Age appearance of both characters, this book contains brief publication histories for each; creator biographies; roleplaying game rules for both the ROLF! and OGL d20 Modern game systems; and never-before seen original fiction by Steve Miller that ties the two characters together and places them in NUELOW Games' emerging superhero universe.

167362.name: Horrors of Egypt
167362.description:
From publisher blurb:

"You're too late to stop the ritual! Anubis lives again!"

The dark magic of ancient Egypt reach across time in illustrated tales of terror from legendary talents such as Joe Kubert and Al Camy.

Horrors of Egypt features six classic horror tales from the Golden Age of Comics, each chronicling the dire fates of those who awaken the ancient Egyptian gods and demons from their age-long slumber.

In addition to the comics, the book contains new rules to let roleplaying gamers create their own chilling tales of ancient evils awakened using the d20 Syatem. Designed by Steve Miller, known for his work on the Ravenloft gothic fantasy gameworld, these rules are fully compatible with other NUELOW Games d20 System supplements. While they are intended for use with OGL Modern, they are easily adaptable to your favorite d20 System variant.

167363.name: Monsters!
167363.description:
Monsters is a 2D action shooter inspired by the classic arcade game Robotron 2084. Wielding “twin stick” controls, the player aims to defeat waves of enemy monsters bent on his destruction. The player must use caution, however, as every shot drains the player’s life/energy. The only way to stay alive is to continuously collect the hearts of the slain monsters. In addition, hearts of different colors provide a variety of “power-up” like abilities that the player can use to their advantage.

The player uses two sets of controls, one to move, the other to fire. Each wave is a single screen populated with a number of enemy monsters of varying types. Coming into contact with an enemy or an enemy projectile will decrease the player’s life/energy. Defeating each level of monsters will allow the player to progress to a more difficult level. The game will progress infinitely as the player defeats each level.

Source: The Developer Website.

167364.name: The Three Lives of Fantomah: Mystery Woman of the Jungle
167364.description:
From publisher blurb:

THE MOST FANTASTIC WOMAN TO HAVE EVER LIVED!

Fantomah, the mystery woman of the jungle, possesses vast supernatural powers that she uses to protect animals and people from evil. Those who enter her realm intent on doing harm will suffer punishments beyond their worst nightmares!

Fantomah first appeared in the pages of Jungle Comics #2 (Fiction House, 1940) and most comics historians identify her as the first female superhero. Over the course of 49 issues, the character went through three distinct stages that were so different from each other that it was almost as if three different characters were presented under the same name. In The Three Lives of Fantomah, NUELOW Games presents highlights from this often over-looked piece of comics history, together with roleplaying game material inspired by it.

The Three Lives of Fantomah: Book One presents a sampling of the bizarre comics of writer/artist Fletcher Hanks, together with a new OGL d20 System prestige class, feats and more. The rules are designed to capture the vast and fluid power of Fantomah, as well as anticipate the changes the character went through as the series evolved. Unlike most comic book characters, Fantomah got less powerful as time went by, something that led to some interesting and unusual game mechanics from Steve Miller (best known for contributions to the Ravenloft setting and several editions of Star Wars roleplaying games).

rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
167365.name: Sherry Flippe
167365.description:
From publisher blurb:

"DON'T WORRY, MR. GRIBBITS! I GOT THIS UNDER CONTROL!"

This month, it's 70 years since private detective Sherry Flippe and her boss, Mr. Gribbitts, worked their first case in the pages of Suspense Comics. Now, five of their whackiest Golden Age adventures have been collected in one book to amuse modern-day comics readers!

Follow Sherry and Gribbitts as the hunt for ghosts, tigers, jewel thieves, and more!

In addition to the classic comics, Sherry Flippe includes rules and characters for use with ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters and Lester Smith's D6xD6 Roleplaying Game.

rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
167366.name: Madden's Boys
167366.description:
From publisher blurb:

TEENAGE HEROES, STRAIGHT FROM THE GOLDEN AGE OF COMICS!

In 1941, artist Bill Madden drew five stories about teen heroes Dynamic Boy and Yankee Boy--one born from a desperate science experiment, the other from pure patriotism. Editor L.L. Hundal has exhumed these early superhero gems from the yellowed. discarded pages of Dynamic Comics 2-3 and Yankee Comics 2-4, and collected them here, in Madden's Boys, so Madden's unique and energetic art can once again be apprecated by comics fans everywhere.

In addition to the comics by Madden, the book also contains support for three different roleplaying game systems.

Designer Scott Capser brings Dynamic Boy and Yankee Boy to Great Scott Games' Hideouts & Hoodlums system.
L.L. Hundal adapts them to ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
Steve Miller brings them to OGL Modern games with an all new approach to using feats and talent trees to create Golden Age superheroes that is fully compatible with NUELOW's Feats of Mysticism & Magic and other OGL d20 products.




"Dynamic Boy! That's the name for him!"
"Nothing can stop Yankee Boy!"

rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
167367.name: The Prankster & The Purple Tigress
167367.description:
From publisher blurb:

Complete Golden Age Oddballs spotlights obscure characters from the Golden Age of comic books, in many cases collecting the stories in one place for the first time ever. Each issue in the series contain every single appearance of one or more quirky heroes from the founding years of the comic book genre, along with all-new roleplaying game content and an occassional bit of fiction.

In this volume, we spotlight the Prankster, a nightclub comedian turned crimefighter, and the Purple Tigress, a busty, headbusting woman of mystery. In addition to every single Golden Age appearance of both characters, this book contains brief publication histories for each character; an overview of how they are being incorporated into NUELOW Games' emerging comic book universe (which will also be featured in Lester Smith's CORE Roleplaying Game); and roleplaying game rules for use with ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game. (There's also a bonus expansion to the OGL Modern superhero rules first published in Madden's Boys.)

rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
167368.name: The Fire-man & The Buzzard
167368.description:
From publisher blurb:

Complete Golden Age Oddballs spotlights obscure characters from the Golden Age of comic books, in many cases collecting the stories in one place for the first time ever. Each issue in the series contain every single appearance of one or more quirky heroes from the founding years of the comic book genre, along with all-new roleplaying game content and an occassional bit of fiction.

In this volume, we spotlight the Fireman and the Buzzard, two 1941 creations from the mind and pen of Martin Filchock, Centaur Publishing's go-to creator for exhuberant, crazy superhero content. In addition to every single Golden Age appearance of both characters, this book contains brief publication histories for each; an overview of how they are being incorporated into NUELOW Games' emerging comic book universe (which will also be featured in Lester Smith's CORE Roleplaying Game); and a bonus expansion to the OGL Modern superhero rules first published in Madden's Boys.

As an extra special treat, the book also contains all for pages of Teen Toons, which Filchock produced in 1948 for Fox Features Syndicate. Even better--it's all presented in color!

Trivia: When Martin Filchock passed away in 2012 at the age of 100, he was America's (and possible the world's) oldest working cartoonist. He had stated in an interview a few years earlier that achieving that status had become his final goal during his twilight years.

rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
167369.name: Kismet & Penny Parker
167369.description:
From publisher blurb:

Complete Golden Age Oddballs spotlights obscure characters from the Golden Age of comic books, in many cases collecting the stories in one place for the first time ever. Each issue in the series contain every single appearance of one or more quirky heroes from the founding years of the comic book genre, along with all-new roleplaying game content and an occassional bit of fiction.

In this volume, we spotlight Kismet, a WW2 Nazi-buster who has the distinction of being the first Muslim superhero; and teenaged detective Penny Parker. In addition to every single Golden Age appearance of both characters, this book contains brief publication histories for each; an overview of how they are being incorporated into NUELOW Games' emerging comic book universe (which will also be featured in Lester Smith's CORE Roleplaying Game); and material for use with ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game. (There's also a bonus expansion to the OGL Modern superhero rules first published in Madden's Boys.)

As an extra special treat, the book also contains two puzzle games by engineer Stephen M. Elonka.

167370.name: Toxic Bunny
167370.description:
Toxic Bunny is a side-scrolling action computer game for DOS computers released in 1996 by Celestial Games. The premise of the game is that a bunny named Toxic, a coffee guzzling, gun slinging maniac who is having a really bad day. The game covers four large levels in which Toxic hunts the person (or animal) responsible for interrupting his coffee break, brainwashing all his friends, and covering the planet with a decaffeinated goo. Within the game you can use any number of incredibly large weapons including a Nitric Hamster Launcher, while squashisng aliens with rusty nautical equipment.

Many say the game is a psychedelic parody of Epic Games character, Jazz Jackrabbit, due to similar game play and the fact that the main protagonist is also a rabbit. However the developers disagree, instead claiming inspirations from the popular 1994 game Earthworm Jim. Toxic Bunny is filled with an abundance of cheesy 90's references and high speed antics.

Toxic Bunny HD

Celestial Games, having re-opened in 2010, started porting Toxic Bunny to Java and decided to give the game a full revamp. This included reanimating sprites and redrawing all the levels. It was released as a boxed product in South Africa on 5 October 2012 under the name Toxic Bunny HD. It is also available for digital sale on the Celestial Games website.[4] The developers of the title, are currently building version 1.3 in Unity (Game Engine) which should be completed May 2013.

Source: Wikipedia, "Toxic Bunny", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167371.name: Judy of the Jungle: The Lords of Memnon
167371.description:
From publisher blurb:

"MY DADDY TOLD ME TO NEVER TRUST A MAN!"

During the Golden Age of Comics, jungle adventure series were all the rage. In 1937, Will Eisner and Jerry Iger hit on the notion that a female jungle hero couldn't help but be popular with the core comic book audience what with the tendency of jungle heroes to not wear much in the way of clothes. So, into existence came Sheena... and shortly after that, the first "fan service" likewise appeared.

Judy of the Jungle debuted in 1947, ten years after Sheena. She first appeared in Exciting Comics #55 where she became popular enough to knock long-time title star Black Terror from the cover within two issues of her debut. She enjoyed a 15-issue run, before fading into history.

Judy may not have been the most groundbreaking of characters, but she was visually distinct from the many other Sheena wanna-bes--where they wore varations of a striped animal skin bikin (like Sheena), Judy's attire was a tattered cocktail dress. She may also have the most unique set of "daddy issues" in all of comicdom. Even better, her adventures never wanted for action.

And her series is titled Judy of the Jungle. This was a comic that was begging for a NUELOW Games edition.

Judy of the Jungle: The Lords of Memnon features the first four Judy adventures, and the debut adventure of the first black jungle hero--Voodah. In addition to 38 pages of great comics, the book includes an all new talent tree and starting occupatiuon designed to bring jungle action to your d20 OGL Mddern games.

Trivia: The creator of Voodah, Matt Baker, was among the first African Americans to draw comics for mainstream publishers.

167372.name: Flower Shop: Summer in Fairbrook
167372.description:
The Flower Shop is a visual novel series by Winter Wolves.

The game offers a mix of classic visual novel gameplay, with dialogues and many choices to make, with a farming minigame. In The Flower Shop - Summer In Fairbrook the player has to grow crops and sell them to get money. It is possible to use fertilizer to speed up the growing process. In The Flower Shop - Winter In Fairbrook the principle is the same, however, this time the player has to grow flowers. The games offer a gallery where the player can watch the achieved endings again. There are nine different endings in each of the games.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Flower Shop", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167373.name: Judy of the Jungle: Warriors of the Laughing Hyena
167373.description:
From publisher blurb:

"THE JUNGLE IS NO PLACE FOR BEASTS LIKE YOU!"

Raised by her misanthrope of a naturalist father to feel more kinship with the animals of the African jungle than with other humans, young Judy champions wildlife and the wilderness along the Yazoo River. She only fully trusts Pistol Roberts, an American ranger. Her general distrust of humanity serves her well, as she finds herself the target of a corrupt big game hunter and comes into conflict with a former circus freak with dreams of building a jumgle empire in this second volume of "Judy of the Jungle" tales from NUELOW Games.

Judy of the Jugle: Warriors of Laughing Hyena features four great comics adventures--three by the character's creator Ralph Mayo, and one by the legendary Frank Frazetta--and two short stories by Charles S. Strong. Additionally, the book contains more rules for use with OGL d20 Modern jungle-based roleplaying games, like those found in the fist book in this series, July of the Jungle: The Lords of Memnon.

"Judy of the Jungle" was originally published by Nedor Comics, debuting as a secondary feature in Exciting Comics in 1947. She was featured in 15 short comics stories, and five fiction pieces. Judy's adventures hold up better than many of the entries in the "jungle girl" genre, which thrived in the pages of comics during the 1940s and early 1950s, including the famous Sheena. We hope that you'll find yourself enjoying these classic tales as much as we here at NUELOW Games do.

167374.name: Judy of the Jungle: Murder Goes Native
167374.description:
From publisher blurb:

MURDER FOLLOWS WHEN SUPERSTITION CHALLENGES SCIENCE

Judy, the jungle-dwelling daughter of an American naturalist, confronts the lethal effects of out-of-control egoes when she crosses paths with a filmmaker and his crew, and struggles against sinister medicine men in the third and final entry in NUELOW Games' Judy of the Jungle series.

In addition to comics and fiction starring Judy, Judy of the Jungle: Murder Goes Native also contains two stories featuring Alani, one of the earliest ethnic comic book leads and one of the few "jungle girls" who wasn't white. Debuting in 1947, the same year Judy of the Jungle made her first appearance, the South Sea Girl series features some of artist Matt Baker's best work.

Finally, the book contains a random story element generator for use when creating your own jungle action adventures for roleplaying games and elsewhere. It also has a special preview of Popcorn Press' forthcoming d6xd6 CORE Roleplaying Game, with Judy, Pistol Roberts, Alani, and other characters featured in the series adapted to the system.

167375.name: Flower Shop: Winter In Fairbrook
167375.description:
The Flower Shop is a visual novel series by Winter Wolves.

The game offers a mix of classic visual novel gameplay, with dialogues and many choices to make, with a farming minigame. In The Flower Shop - Summer In Fairbrook the player has to grow crops and sell them to get money. It is possible to use fertilizer to speed up the growing process. In The Flower Shop - Winter In Fairbrook the principle is the same, however, this time the player has to grow flowers. The games offer a gallery where the player can watch the achieved endings again. There are nine different endings in each of the games.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Flower Shop", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167376.name: Pat Patriot
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
167376.description:
From publisher blurb:

AMERICA'S JOAN OF ARC!

When first-generation American Patricia Patrios decided to complain about harsh working conditions on the factory assembly line, it started a series of events that would pit her against Nazi agents, gangsters, and other enemies of the American Dream. In 1941, as war-clouds gathered on America's shores, "Pat Patriot" became a symbol of the American spirit for the people to rally around.

Pat Patriot presents the four best adventures of this largely forgotten Golden Age patriotic female hero, who debuted several months before Wonder Woman. In addition to the classic comic book tales, the book features a complete ROLF! supplement in which sat is teamed with another great American hero, Bronze Terror!

Trivia: Pat Patriot (as well as the Bronze Terror) came to be during a long weekend of feverish creation when publisher Lev Gleason crammed writers and artists into a couple of hotel rooms to make content for a follow-up series to the one-shot Daredevil Battles Hitler. She was featured in Daredevil Comics 2 - 11 (Agu. 1941 - June 1942). The series title was intially used on an unrelated one-shot gag strip starring a blond teenaged boy.

167377.name: Warrior Maiden Starlight
167377.description:
From publisher blurb:

"I can stalk a deer and wing my shafts as well as any fledgling warrior!"

Starlight was as wild and tempesteous as the wendigo winds, and in her breast beat the heart of a warrior. She viewed with contempt the idea that women should be modest and content to cook and weave for the men who hunted and fended off the enemies of Huron people. So, she termed herself a warrior-maiden, and set out to prove that her arrows struck as true, and her knife cut as deep, as that wielded by any man.

Warrior Maiden Starlight chronicles the adventures of a strong-willed young woman, as she refuses to submit to gender roles in Huron society some two centuries before European settlers made contact with the Native Americans of the northeast.

Starlight was the last in a string of strong female characters to be featured in comics anthologoes from Fiction House, the most famous of these being Sheena, Queen of the Jungle. Originally published in Indians #2 - #8 in 1951, this book is the first time all seven installments of the series have been collected in one volume anywhere. This is a series and a character that don't deserve the total obsurity into which they have fallen, as it's one of the best of its kind. NUELOW Games hopes it will be rediscovered by many readers.

In addition to the classic comics by Ralph Mayo (artist of the Judy of the Jungle series, also available from NUELOW Games), Warrior Maiden Starlight features an outline for an OGL d20 game setting titled First Americans, which includes some new feats and game stats for the fearsome Wendio.

167378.name: Exodus of Sol
167378.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




We thought that our sun would last another five billion years.
We were wrong.

Now the battle for humanity has begun.

Game Features

New Missions

Wage war against the Children of Dawn in all new missions! Now featuring LESS ESCORT! :) Train around a never-before-discovered planet, survive a massive capital ship battle in deep space, bombard a fuel refinery, and so much more!

Stunning Environments

Visit gorgeous landmarks in our Solar System including: Pluto and the Kuiper Belt, Neptune’s Moon Triton, Neptune, Saturn, Uranus, Titan, and more!

More Pilot-able Ships

Pilot multiple ships – each with their own distinct look and feel. Our ships also feature new handling physics blending realism with accessibility, transfer energy between various ship subsystems, and even repair in mid-flight!

Enhanced Audio

All new music designed to get your blood pumping during intense dogfights, new sound effects improve the overall aural feeling of the game, and new voiceover to accompany the new and improved missions!

Source: The Developer Website.

167379.name: NUELOW Summer Special
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
167379.description:
From publisher blurb:

FUN IN THE SUN!

The NUELOW Summer Special celebrates the arrival of summer with a collection of teen comedy classics from the Golden Age of Comics! Hit the beach with the ditzy Corliss Archer, the overly helpful Candy, the sunbathing beauty Suzie, and the intensly jealous Kathy. And then you can hit the bad guys with Black Cat, as NUELOW's superhero mascot goes water-skiing!

In addition to great comics by talents such as Al Feldstein and Lee Elias, the Summer Special contains a complete supplement for ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters in which Kathy learns that even in summer-time, a cemetery is not a good place for romantic interludes.

167380.name: Kathy
rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
167380.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Oh, how super-scrumptious, Hank. Tonight we live!"

She's the queen of jukeboxes and hi-jinx, and now she's back!

Among the many genres that thrived during the Golden Age of Comics was the teen comedy, sometimes with romantic elements, sometimes not. One example of these was Standard's Kathy, a series that lasted eight epidodes in the anthology series Thrilling Comics and eventually being awarded its own title in 1954.

Kathy was at its best in the earliest episodes, with stories fast-paced stories that read like modern-day television sit-coms ahd which are blessed with art superior to almost any other teen comedy strips, as it was by the dream team of Frank Frazetta and Ralph Mayo.

NUELOW Games' Kathy collects all four of the Frazetta/Mayo-illustrated episodes in one place. The book may be of special interest to those like to examine the techinical aspects of comic book art, as Mayo and Frezaetta handle different aspects of the art on different stories.

In addition to the classic comics, Kathy includes a complete supplement for ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fifghters. It features a story in which Kathy meets actress Linda Turner (secretly the Black Cat), four battle scenarios, seven pre-generated characters, and a selection of Traits and Battle Maneuvers not included in the main rulebook.

167381.name: Crystals of Time
167381.description:
User Summary

Help Ashley Ford find her father and solve the mystery of the Three Oak Mansion. Ashley is a professional thief, like his father. Her father suddenly disappeared one night while he was trying to sneak into the Three Oak Mansion.

You start the game in front of a big, deserted house which is hiding a lot of secrets. You are carrying a mysterious crystal that will help you travel in time and thus finding the clues that will lead to the answers.

167382.name: Pollywog
167382.description:
User Summary

A simple pond simulation, Pollywog has you living the life of frogs. You start the game with a dozen eggs that hatch into a school of pollywogs (tadpoles). Control the school with the joystick and eat the algae. As the pollywogs eat they slowly mature into frogs. Avoid the orange creepies and the great white fish. They eat pollywogs and frogs, But frogs can eat the creepies as well.

Eating all the algae in the pond or eating all the creepies will advance you to another pond. There are 64 ponds and you'll advance as many pond as there are pollywogs left. If you have 10 pollywogs after the first pond, you'll advance to pond #11.

167383.name: Odyssey: The Compleat Apventure
167383.description:
Odyssey: The Compleat Apventure was a videogame written by Robert Clardy and released by Synergistic Software in 1980. It was created for the Apple II platform and is considered one of the first microcomputer-based role-playing video games. The title was intentionally misspelled; Apventure is a reference to the Apple computer.

A forerunner of Akalabeth and Ultima, Odyssey was a multi-part adventure game that placed the player in the role of the leader of an army who sets out to vanquish an evil wizard. Elements of Dungeons & Dragons can be found within the game, which combines elements of two earlier games written by Clardy: Dungeon Campaign and Wilderness Campaign.

The game features several major sections. Except for the endgame section, the game play is presented in a top-down map format with limited animation and sound effects.
Source: Wikipedia, "Odyssey: The Compleat Apventure", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167384.name: Cybermax (ICONS)
167384.description:
From publisher blurb:

With the release of Assembled Edition, ICONS is back and better than ever.

Worlds Most Wanted helps you get to the fun faster with pregenerated villains, adventure hooks and maps.

Cybermax is the code name used by law enforcement for a mysterious robotic criminal who’s wanted on charges of theft, espionage, associating with known supervillains and meta‐terrorism.

Are your heroes up to the task of stopping it?

167385.description:
This is a set of four cards exclusive to Kickstarter backers of Villagers & Villains: The Borderlands. It is an expansion to Villagers & Villains and can be added to that base game with or without the Borderlands expansion.

This small promo pack includes one card of each of the four card types:


Gypsy Vendor (Citizen)
Hunger (Challenge)
Convention Hall (Building)
CosPlay Hero (Hero)
167385.name: Villagers & Villains: The Borderlands Kickstarter Promo Pack

167386.name: Apventure To Atlantis
167386.description:
The sequel to Odyssey: The Compleat Apventure called Apventure to Atlantis has the story pick up with the player as ruler of the island and updates the format of the game to include internal areas displayed in the form of the then-current Mystery House game, and also incorporated a parser that allowed the use of text adventure-style commands.

Source: Wikipedia, "Odyssey: The Compleat Apventure", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

167387.description:
Yomi EX Powerup contains a new gold character card and four copies of an extra rank of face cards called Destiny cards for each of the twenty characters in the second edition of Yomi; it also includes a premium knockdown token and an oversized Deathstrike Dragon character card so that he can play against two other players in a 2v1 match. The box has a sleeve with product information that can be removed, leaving a display-worthy box.

This expansion powers up all twenty Yomi second edition character decks, letting you play the EX version of every character. Note that EX characters are overpowered, not tournament-legal, and not balanced.
167387.name: Yomi EX Powerup

167388.name: 6d6 Core
167388.description:
from the back of the book

Fast, simple, character-driven role playing for any genre.

167389.name: 6d6 Modern
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
167389.description:
from the back of the book

Fast character creation for the 6d6 RPG, using archetypes for simplicity or character paths for flexibility. 6d6 Modern contains everything needed for creating distinctive, exciting characters for a wide range of genres including espionage, urban fantasy, crime capers and zombies.

167390.name: 100 Monster Bestiary
167390.description:
from the back of the book

A massive bestiary of ready-to-use foes for the 6d6 RPG. This genre-spanning collection has monsters for any campaign, including aliens with acid for blood, goblins, skeleton warriors, mummies, nazis, yetis and pterodactyls. In addition to the fully detailed monsters, there are mooks to support them, plus monster paths with hundreds of advantages allowing you to quickly create your perfect creature.

167391.name: Spinergy G-Rings: Mmm...Chocolate! and Hullaballoo
167391.description:
Two themed ring sets for the game Spinergy.

Mmm...Chocolate! is a 3-ring set with words pertaining to chocolate. (ie- fudge, sprinkled, dark)

Hullaballoo is a 3-ring set with words pertaining to sounds. (ie- car alarm, sonar, mosquito)
Added Rule: In your response, you must create the sounds represented by each of the 3 words.

The rings from the two sets can be mixed and matched with each other or with the rings of the base game or other expansion.

rpg: It Came to Town That Night
167392.name: It Came to Town That Night
167392.description:
From the introduction of the item:

a game of horror movie action and fear for 4 or more players—powered by the apocalypse

167395.description:
Roman Conqueror is a semi-historical simulation of the conquest of the Roman Empire. The Player assumes the role of the Consul of Rome during the early period of the Roman Empire. Rome is feeling the confidence of their advancements in technology, culture and military might.
OBJECTIVE: As the Consul of Rome you are anxious to spread the knowledge and culture of Rome to neighboring Territories, as well as, increasing the wealth and prosperity of the Roman population (and of course, yourself). The Player must raise Legions and assign Generals to conquer as many Territories as possible before the last Campaign Card is drawn, thus, ending your magnificent reign.

GAME FEATURES: Roman Conqueror includes many colorful counters representing the various Troops of the time, including, Legion Infantry, Auxiliary Infantry, Elephants, Heavy and Light Chariots, Peltasts, Horse Archers and Warbands. The game is Card-Driven and event includes rules for Gladiatorial Combat, Chariot Races, and Naval Combat. Enemy Civilizations include Barbarians (Germans, Belgai, Gauls), Sarmatians (Huns, Goths, Dacians), Parthians (Persians), and Carthaginians.
